application.doc: Updating a file in the administration pages root

param.name: id
param.doc: The relative path of the file to be updated. The top-level directory must be one of management, errors, oauth, snippets, or junction-root. For example, management/C.

method.name: PUT
method.id: Updating a file in the administration pages root
method.doc: To update a file in the administration pages root with the RESTful web service, issue an HTTP PUT command on the Administration Pages Root files resource URI.

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

param.name: contents
param.doc: The new contents of the file. Use this parameter when you update the contents of the file directly. When this parameter is used, do not use the file parameter at the same time.

param.name: file
param.doc: The new contents of the file as an uploaded file. Use this parameter when you update the contents of the file with the contents of this new file. When this parameter is used, do not use the contents parameter at the same time.

param.name: type
param.doc: The type of resource to update. In this case, it is "file".

response.doc:
200 ok
Note: For the changes to take effect, they must be deployed as described in Configuration changes commit process.
There is a problem with the request. The JSON message describes the problem.
File not Found, The requested service does not exist. The JSON message indicates which resource.
An internal error occurred. The JSON message indicates the problem.
